mention.text: U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia
Judge Bork , appointed by Mr. Reagan in 1982 to the U.S. Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia
Judge Bork , who stood next to him without comment , as an `` impressive legal mind '' and `` a premier constitutional authority
liberal Democrats on the Senate Judiciary Committee
Democratic Sen. Edward Kennedy of Massachusetts , a Judiciary Committee member
Democratic Sen. Edward Kennedy of Massachusetts
Judiciary Chairman Joseph Biden , a Delaware Democrat , and Democratic Sen. Paul Simon of Illinois , both presidential candidates
The president 's nominee to become the 104th justice
a narrow view of the First Amendment guarantee of freedom of speech
the Justice Department official who represents the executive branch before the Supreme Court
solicitor general , the Justice Department official who represents the executive branch before the Supreme Court
Mr. Richardson , now a Washington lawyer
the federal appeals court in Washington , D.C.
those views that will be scrutinized closely by the Senate
a woman 's right to an abortion , and Judge Bork 's criticism of sexual privacy
Judge Bork 's criticism of sexual privacy
a University of Chicago law professor
a good friend of President Reagan 's last nominee , Justice Antonin Scalia
a powerful force at the Supreme Court
Those who know him expect he
